trailingComments.value: Will return w, nw, n, ne, e, se, s, sw for the eight borders,
M for inside, or "" when current location not in `dirs`.

leadingComments.value: Will return w, nw, n, ne, e, se, s, sw for the eight borders,
M for inside, or "" when current location not in `dirs`.
Don't do anything if we're currently dragging.
Otherwise, the cursor might jump horribly!
Also don't do anything if no cursors.

trailingComments.value: Bwahahahaha this works even when one is at index 0.

leadingComments.value: Bwahahahaha this works even when one is at index 0.
Only unset cursor if we're not dragging,
otherwise we get horrible cursor-flipping action.
Also only unset it if we actually did set it!

trailingComments.value: Still need to unset here, in case the user stop dragging
while the mouse isn't on the element anymore (e.g. off-limits).

leadingComments.value: Still need to unset here, in case the user stop dragging
while the mouse isn't on the element anymore (e.g. off-limits).

trailingComments.value: Potentially dynamically determine the allowed space.

leadingComments.value: Potentially dynamically determine the allowed space.

trailingComments.value: Handle moving around first, more easily.

leadingComments.value: This is so that even moving the mouse super-fast, this still "sticks" to the extent.

trailingComments.value: Now check for all possible resizes.

leadingComments.value: First, check for vertical resizes,

trailingComments.value: and then for horizontal ones. Note both may happen.

leadingComments.value: and then for horizontal ones. Note both may happen.

comments.value: Copyright (c) 2015 Lucas Beyer
Licensed under the MIT License (MIT)
Version 1.0
https://github.com/lucasb-eyer/d3-boundingbox
ES6 "translation" by (c) 2015 Nick Bollweg
All those are initialized to default further down using the setters.
Will return w, nw, n, ne, e, se, s, sw for the eight borders,
M for inside, or "" when current location not in `dirs`.
Don't do anything if we're currently dragging.
Otherwise, the cursor might jump horribly!
Also don't do anything if no cursors.
Bwahahahaha this works even when one is at index 0.
Only unset cursor if we're not dragging,
otherwise we get horrible cursor-flipping action.
Also only unset it if we actually did set it!
Still need to unset here, in case the user stop dragging
while the mouse isn't on the element anymore (e.g. off-limits).
Potentially dynamically determine the allowed space.
Handle moving around first, more easily.
This is so that even moving the mouse super-fast, this still "sticks" to the extent.
Now check for all possible resizes.
First, check for vertical resizes,
and then for horizontal ones. Note both may happen.
coolface
